title: Adding ophcrack LiveCD v 2.3.1 to a multiboot dvd ??

forumNotes.author: shamurshamur
forumNotes.content:
So here's the situation !  

ophcrack live cd uses slitaz linux distro.  

By default slitaz login automatically in to a account name "tux" , which don't have administrator privileges.  

After login a script named "launch.sh" runs automatically. (which finds tables on the cd)  

I have added ophcrack live cd to a multiboot dvd. But when I run the ophcrack it stops with an error " tables not found".  

After getting this error i tried to relaunch the script "launch.sh" from command-line.  

I have found this:  
if i run the script as the user "tux" , i get this error again.  
if i run the script as the user "root" , the tables are found.  

ps:  
I have run the original iso file in vmware and it runs fine and tables were found.  
but when i run in multiboot dvd it stops with this error.

forumNotes.author: cdob
forumNotes.content:
How do you build the DVD?  

Use mkisofs -r instead of -R.  

Explanation:  
-R: rock ridge extension with permissions.   
-r: rock ridge extension without permissions.   

DVD builded at windows without account name "tux":  
ophcrack user "tux" dosn't have permission to read the DVD, hence tables are not found.  
ophcrack user "root" have permission to read the DVD, tables are found.

forumNotes.author: shamurshamur
forumNotes.content:
> How do you build the DVD?  
>
> Use mkisofs -r instead of -R.  
>
> Explanation:  
> -R: rock ridge extension with permissions.   
> -r: rock ridge extension without permissions.   
>
> DVD builded at windows without account name "tux":  
> ophcrack user "tux" dosn't have permission to read the DVD, hence tables are not found.  
> ophcrack user "root" have permission to read the DVD, tables are found.
ok! i will rebuild the dvd with -r option ......but i am worried , what effect this option will have on my other distros on dvd cause i have already tested others distros thouroughly and they are working fine.

forumNotes.author: cdob
forumNotes.content:
> i will rebuild the dvd with -r option
Did you used -R before?  

> but i am worried , what effect will this option have on my other distros on dvd
All disgtros works fine still, if you changed -R to -r.

forumNotes.author: shamurshamur
forumNotes.content:
Thanks a lot cdob!! ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)   
working like a charm!!  
And other distros are also working fine like before ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)   

**ps:**   
> Did you used -R before?
yes , i was using - R option before
